intro: Habranthus auratus, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soil and full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a basal rosette. Habranthus auratus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
